introduce.title: AngusTester Parameterization Methods
introduce.description: Define reusable variables, dynamic data, mock functions, and parameter extraction mechanisms to automate testing workflows.

variable.title: Variable
variable.content: Define constant values that can be reused throughout the testing process.

dataset.title: Dataset
dataset.content: Define a set of related test data that updates dynamically during execution.

mockFunction.title: Mock Function
mockFunction.content: Dynamically generate parameter values or random values during execution.

samplingExtraction.title: Sampling Extraction Variable
samplingExtraction.content: Extract values from previous response as parameters for subsequent sampling, re-extracting on each iteration.

emptyData.noVariable: You haven't added any variables yet,
emptyData.noDataset: You haven't added any datasets yet,
emptyData.noDataSource: You haven't added any data sources

introduce.title: About Variable
introduce.description: Define reusable values. Use {variableName} placeholder to reference variables, making testing more efficient and flexible. Note: Placeholders will be replaced with actual values before execution, and values remain unchanged during execution.

fileExtract.title: File Extraction
fileExtract.description: Extract values from files as variables. For example: reading a secret key.

httpExtract.title: HTTP Extraction
httpExtract.description: Extract values from HTTP requests as variables. For example: dynamically obtaining a token.

jdbcExtract.title: JDBC Extraction
jdbcExtract.description: Extract variable values from data source tables according to SQL. For example: current product price.

uploadArea.description: You can drag files directly into this area for upload. File size should not exceed {maxSize}M. Supports .json, .yaml, .yml file types.

list.noVariableData: You haven't added any variables yet,

staticVariable.passwordHint: If the variable is a password type, the variable value is invisible to the user on the interface.
staticVariable.hints: If a variable contains mock functions, it auto-refreshes before each iteration (the value persists for all requests within that iteration).

httpVariable.hints: Extract a value from Http before each test execution, commonly used to obtain a user access token, avoiding manual updates each time.

httpConfigs.title: HTTP Configuration
httpConfigs.requestBodyPlaceholder: Please enter the request body content
httpConfigs.serverVariableNotFound: The variable cannot be found. Please define the variable or refresh and try again

requestBodyParameter.title: Request Body Parameter
requestBodyParameter.parameterValuePlaceholder: Please enter the parameter value, maximum 4096 characters
requestBodyParameter.summaryFileSize: The total uploaded file size cannot exceed {maxSize}

jdbcVariable.hints: Extract a value from the database query result before each test execution.
jdbcVariable.selectStatementPlaceholder: Query Table Data Select Statement, maximum 1024 characters

fileVariable.hints: Extract a value from the file before each test execution.
fileVariable.filePathPlaceholder: File Local Path or File URL, maximum 800 characters
fileVariable.separatorTooltip: Csv type file parameter. Used to separate different fields or data columns in the CSV file, the default value is ",".
fileVariable.escapeCharTooltip: Csv type file parameter, used to escape special characters in the field, especially when the quote character itself is included as a text character, the default is "\\".
fileVariable.quoteCharTooltip: Csv type file parameter. Used to represent the start and end of the field in the CSV file, especially when the field contains special characters such as delimiters (such as commas) or line breaks, the default is "\\".

introduce.title: About Dataset
introduce.description: Used to define a set of related data parameter values, usually actual test data, such as: user data, order data, account data, etc. After defining a dataset, you can use parameter name placeholders {parameterName} to reference dataset parameters.
introduce.note: Note: Datasets are loaded before execution sampling, and parameter values are dynamically changed during the sampling process. AngusTester supports the following three ways to define datasets:

staticDataset.title: Static Dataset
staticDataset.description: Use Mock functions and constant values to define a set of values as a dataset.

fileExtract.title: File Extraction
fileExtract.description: Extract a set of parameter values from a file as a dataset.

jdbcExtract.title: Jdbc Extraction
jdbcExtract.description: Extract a set of parameter values from a datasource as a dataset.

uploadArea.description: You can drag files directly into this area for upload. File size should not exceed {maxSize}M. Supports .json, .yaml, .yml file types.

list.noDataText: You haven't added any datasets yet, immediately

messages.batchDeleteMaxError: Maximum {maxNum} datasets can be batch deleted, currently {num} datasets are selected.
messages.batchDeleteConfirm: Are you sure to delete the selected {num} datasets?
messages.batchDeleteMaxInfo: Maximum {maxNum} datasets can be batch deleted, currently {num} datasets are selected.

form.hints: Read dataset from file, each dataset allows a maximum of 200 parameters, each parameter file cannot exceed 500MB, and the total number of rows cannot exceed 1000000.
form.filePathPlaceholder: File local path or file URL, maximum 800 characters
form.separatorTooltip: Csv type file parameter. Used to separate different fields or data columns in CSV files, the default value is ",".
form.escapeCharTooltip: Csv type file parameter, used to escape special characters in fields, especially when the quote character itself is included as a text character, the default is "\".
form.quoteCharTooltip: Csv type file parameter. Used to represent the start and end of fields in CSV files, especially when fields contain special characters such as separators (such as commas) or line breaks, the default is "\".

form.hints: Extract a value from the database query result before each test execution as a dataset value.
form.selectStatementPlaceholder: Select statement to query table data, no need to specify paging parameters, default fetch 5000 rows each time, maximum 1024 characters

notifications.batchDeleteLimit: Maximum support batch deletion of {max} resources, currently {current} resources are selected.
notifications.batchDeleteConfirm: Confirm to delete the selected {num} resources?
notifications.batchDeleteAllSuccess: The selected {num} resources were all deleted successfully
notifications.batchDeleteAllFail: The selected {num} resources were all deleted failed
notifications.batchDeletePartialSuccess: The selected {success} resources were deleted successfully, {fail} resources were deleted failed
notifications.batchDeleteLimitInfo: Maximum support batch deletion of {max} resources, currently {current} resources are selected.

parameterNameInput.tooltip: The parameter name order must be consistent with the file column data order, each name must be 100 characters or less.

staticDataset.hints: Generate parameter values dynamically using Mock data functions. Each dataset supports up to 200 parameters and can generate up to 100 billion rows of data.

preview.hints: Preview limited to 10k records. Mock parameters generate during sampling.

datasource.title: Data Source
datasource.description: Supports managing and connecting multiple datasource. After configuring datasource information, you can quickly generate test data, project demonstration scenarios, and quickly reference data source configuration information in JDBC tests, parameterized variables, and datasets.

introduce.title: About File
introduce.description: Provides online generation and storage functions for test data and business data files, with support for multi-person collaborative management and sharing.

generateData.title: Data Generation
generateData.content: Generate data files in multiple formats such as CSV, Excel, SQL, JSON, and XML for testing and business use.

storageAndBackup.title: Storage and Backup
storageAndBackup.content: Upload files to network disk for data backup and secure storage, preventing data loss and sharing issues.

securityAndProtection.title: Security Protection
securityAndProtection.content: Ensure data security and privacy through data-level permissions and encryption protection for uploaded files.

spaceManagement.title: Space Management
spaceManagement.content: Provide storage space quota management with scalable capacity to meet storage needs of different scales.

fileManagement.createDirectory: Enter directory name, limited to 50 characters

notifications.passwordEmpty: The input password cannot be empty

permissionModal.title: Space Permission
permissionModal.onTips: After enabling permission control, manual authorization is required to have corresponding operation permissions.
permissionModal.offTips: No permission restrictions, all users in the account can view and operate, permission control is not enabled by default.

globalAuth.title: Space Permission
globalAuth.description: Grant specified "function" operation permissions to users, departments, and groups. When granting permissions, "VIEW" permission is required. Users can only authorize functions for which they have authorization permissions.

spaceForm.title: Add Space

placeholders.spaceName: Enter space name, limited to 100 characters

spaceForm.quotaDescription: (Limit the total storage size that the space can use, minimum 100MB)

common.nameSupportPlaceholder: Enter name, which supports numbers, letters, and !$%^&*_-+=./
common.readStartRowTooltip: Read Parameter Value Start Row, default index based on 0, i.e. read the first row.
common.readStartColumnTooltip: Read Parameter Start Column, default index based on 0, i.e. read the first column.

messages.batchDeleteConfirm: Are you sure to delete the selected {num} items?
messages.maxBatchDelete: Maximum {maxNum} variables can be batch deleted, currently {num} items are selected.
messages.maxBatchDeleteError: Maximum {maxNum} items can be batch deleted, currently {num} items are selected.

matchItemPopover.title: Match Item Description
matchItemPopover.description: Match item is used to extract data from the response, supports multiple matching methods:

regexp.title: Regular Expression
regexp.item: Use regular expression to extract data from the response, support group capture.

jsonpath.title: JSONPath
jsonpath.item: Use JSONPath expression to extract data from the JSON response.

xpath.title: XPath
xpath.item: Use XPath expression to extract data from the XML response.

previewData.title: Preview Data
previewData.tip: Variable values resolve before sampling and persist unchanged throughout execution.
